intro: Lepilaena cylindrocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hop萧, is a small shrub native to southern Australia. It features narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikes, which bloom in spring. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. The species is of interest in horticulture due to its ornamental value and resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
